intro: Elatostema ranongense var. ranongense, commonly known as the Ranong Elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Malaysia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
